titleStmt.title: The particulars contraverted between the town of Leith and Edinburgh may be reduced briefly into two heads; some relate to the point of right, the rest are in fact, and points of grievance against the twon of Edinburgh's doing. Although their right were uncontraverted.

notesStmt.note: Place and date of publication suggested by Wing (2nd ed.).
Imperfect: crease, print show-through with loss of text.
Abreviat of the debate between Edinburgh and Leith before the Council of Scotland in 1655 regarding the control exercised by Edinburgh over Leith's trade.
Reproduction of original in: National Library of Scotland.
